text: Langley, Illinois.  A quiet suburb located fifty miles outside of Chicago.
SUPER the legend:  "Langley, Illinois.  October 28th 1998
nestled in the middle of a tree-lined street.  A Honda Ci pulls into a darkened driveway, the headlights are extinguished...
PAMELA WHITTINGTON, a middle-aged woman in full registere nurse attire, emerges from the parked car.
An unlit cigarette dangles loosely from her lips.  She he to the porch, digging through her purse in search of a light...
Pamela stops in her tracks, looks down at her feet to dis
scattered across the porch.  She looks at the porch light hanging above her head.
A SHATTERED LIGHT BULB occupies the socket.
Pamela turns her attention to the front door... it's slig ajar.  She pushes on it gently.... the door swings open freely, revealing the darkened interior.
Shit...
Pamela drops her purse... darts across some hedges into t neighbor's yard...
Pamela runs up to the porch, decorated with carved pumpkins... POUNDS furiously on the front door, decorated with a CARDBOARD SKELETON.
She POUNDS again... HARDER.  Suddenly, the door SWINGS op to reveal
looming in the doorway.  A HOCKEY MASK cloaks his face.
glare at Pamela from behind the cut-outs in the plastic vizard.
gasps, stumbles backward.
flips up his mask to reveal
a gangly teen, wearing a hockey jersey... skates slung ov his shoulder.
Hey, Mis Whittington, what's up?
My blood pleasure.  You scared the hell out of me.
Oh.  Sorry.  I'm on my way to the ring and --
(interrupting) I think someone broke into my house.
No shit?!
No shit.
Pamela sits on the couch taking hits off a lit cigarette. Jimmy paces the room, portable phone pressed against his
(into phone) 3037 Keystone.. yeah... gotcha.
Jimmy hangs up the portable...
(continuing) Said to give 'em fifteen minutes. They'll send someone by.
Jimmy grabs his hockey stick, heads for the door.
Jimmy, what are you doing?
Checking out your place.
No.  Wait for the police.
And miss the big game?  No way.
Pamela stands at the foot of her driveway... watches as J climbs the steps to her porch, hockey stick perched high his shoulder.
moves toward the front door, stepping on pieces of shatte light bulb beneath him.
He swings open the front door with the tip of his stick.. looks inside the darkened house.
He enters cautiously, stick at the ready.
lights up another cigarette, watches nervously as Jimmy disappears from view...
Jimmy enters the dimmed foyer.
(calling off) Hey, man, don't mess with me! I'll knock your head clean off your body!

He moves stealthily through the house, hockey stick poise high in the air... room-by-room he checks for intruders.. Jimmy finds his way to the rear of the home, crosses to a back bedroom, stands in the doorway...
(continuing) Oh, shit...
Converted to a home office... ransacked... file cabinets overturned, pictures hang crooked on the walls, papers ca the floor...
drops the stick to his side, convinced he is now alone in house.
He crosses back into the kitchen... steals a cookie from cookie jar... opens the fridge... takes a swig from an op milk carton... completely unaware that --
is opening slowly behind him, then suddenly --
An IRONING BOARD topples out from inside, slams against h back, hard.
snaps the hockey stick into position... spins around... swings wildly with the wooden baton.  He makes contact wi
suspended above the island... pots dangling from their ho come clanging down on top of him...
The dust settles... Jimmy realizes he's been beating the stuffing out of an ironing board.  He sheepishly exits th kitchen...
Pamela stands at the foot of the driveway, trying to see to the darkened house...
Come on, damn it...
Jimmy emerges from the house... looks like Wayne Gretsky after slamming in his record goal.  He smiles at Pamela smugly...
Nothing to fear.  The coast is clear.
You sure?
Totally.  I checked all the rooms and closets...
Nothing's missing?
Don't think so.  But they sure did a real number on your office. Crap everywhere.
My office?
Yeah.  Oh, and they messed up your kitchen pretty good, too... Goodnight.
Jimmy scurries off, avoiding any more questions.
Pamela heads back to the house.
Pamela enters the house, LOCKS AND BOLTS the front door behind her.  She breathes a heavy sigh of relief, back against the door... she flicks on a light switch... NOTHI
Christ, Jimmy... didn't you try the goddamn lights?!
Pamela moves down the hallway to the laundry room... she opens the door to the FUSE BOX... toggles some fuses on a off... tries the laundry room light... still NOTHING, darkness.
(continuing) Shit.
She grabs a flashlight out of the nearby cupboard, and proceeds down the hall to --
The converted bedroom in complete disarray... Pamela navigates through the wreckage, carving a path with the b of her flashlight.  She approaches --
completely bare except for a single FILE FOLDER resting o its top.
shines the beam on the lone file folder.
ON the folder... the index tab reads "KERI TATE."  Pamela opens the folder, it's EMPTY.
gasps, the blood rushes from her face.  She immediately rushes for the phone.
A noise is heard.  She's not alone in this house.  She mo through the hallway to discover the front door wide open. Shit.  She bolts.
Pamela runs out the door and back to Jimmy's house.  She opens the front door, disappears inside.
Pamela shuts the door behind her... cranes her neck, searching for any signs of Jimmy --
She HEARS the sounds of a television emanating from deep within the house.
(calling off) Jimmy!  You still there?!
CAMERA FOLLOWS Pamela as she makes her way from one darke room to the next... she crosses into the den to discover
seated in an easy-chair, watching an episode of "SEINFELD his back to Pamela... only his legs are visible from her point-of-view.
Pamela approaches him --
Goddamnit, Jimmy!  Someone's still in my house!
Pamela spins the easy-chair around to reveal --
embedded deep into Jimmy's face... the blade slicing thro flesh, from forehead to chin... eyes wide open in terror. blood cascades down his jersey...
screams... bolts through the house, reaches the front doo find --
pushed in front of it, blocks her way!  She tries fiercel move the wooden hutch, but can't...
Pamela runs back through the house, frantic... in despera search of an exit.
She crosses into the kitchen, spots her escape... moves t the rear door, opens it to reveal...
standing, poised, evil eyes burning through slits in his trademark mask.
shrieks... grabs a knife out of a nearby butcher block... heads back to the living room.
moves after her, the hunt is on...
illuminate the room...
runs to a window...
A squad car arrives in front of Pamela's house.  Two UNIFORMED COPS emerge from the vehicle, head up her drive
Struggles to open the window... she can't manage to disen the lock... she pounds feverishly on the glass --
(yelling) HELP!  GODDAMNIT IT!  OVER HERE! GOD PLEASE!
appears behind her... grabs an IRON POKER from a group of fireplace utensils.
spins around, swings at the Shape with the knife...
Stay the fuck away from me!
The Shape swings the iron poker... delivers a severe blow Pamela's arm... breaks it... the knife falls to the floor below.
Pamela howls in pain... drops to her knees, nurses her ar
The Shape raises the poker high into the air, comes down hard... drives the tip of the poker through her skull...
In the f.g. two cops climb the porch steps and move into house.
In the b.g. we can see the Shape through the neighboring window as he repeatedly stabs Pamela with the poker.
THE CAMERA PULLS BACK TO REVEAL a co-ed boarding school.. set behind massive wrought-iron gates on acreage in a secluded region of Wisconsin.
SUPER the legend:  "Ferndale, Wisconsin.  October 29th 19

The academy's gothic architecture and rich history can be seen throughout the entire campus, consisting of a cluste buildings:  the school, the dorms, a gymnasium with indoo swimming pool, a bell tower, a guard house and --
litters the far end of the campus.
CLOSE ON a kitchen window.  Inside KERI TATE, mid-thirtie stands behind a sink washing dishes.
On closer inspection, we see that this face is none other that LAURIE STRODE.
Keri stands with her back to JOHN, 16, chiseled good look He stands behind her in the doorway... They are in mid- conversation --
Nothing's changed since yesterday, or last week, or last month... the answer's still "no."
You're so predictable.
Keri grabs the sprayer, squirts John from across the room
(continuing) What the --
Betcha' didn't predict that.
Keri throws John a dishtowel... he dabs at his shirt.
I'm sixteen, Keri.  I should be able to live wherever I want.
And I should have a son who calls me "Mom".  Looks like we're both shit out of luck.
Okay, you win.  I'll call you Mom. Now can I move into the dorms?
No.
Keri hands John a stack of clean dishes.  John doesn't budge...
Well, Dad thinks it's okay.
You're father thinks it's okay to run off to Cancun with a blonde bimbo in a halter top.  Somehow his opinion doesn't count.
I promise not to run off to Cancun.
Forget it.
(pointing out the kitchen window) The dorms are only fifty feet away.  You could practically see into my window.  So, what difference does it make?
My point exactly.  See, we both agree.
Keri takes the dishes back from John, puts them away in a overhead cupboard.
Alright, I was wrong.  There is a big difference between rooming with your buddies and living with your mother and school headmaster.
I took the padlock off your door. What more do you want?
My life is a living hell.
Keri raises an eyebrow...
It's not, trust me.
John gives up, heads out of the room...
(continuing) Where are you going?
To the bathroom.  Can I do that alone or do you want to watch?
I thought you'd never ask.
Keri puts her arms around John, escorts him out of the kitchen...
You're twisted.
I know.
Keri moves across campus toward the school, a leather briefcase slung over one shoulder.
Passing STUDENTS ad-lib "Hellos," their admiration for Ke made evident by their favorable rapport with her.
Keri passes in front of --
parked alongside the school.  An older bus on the far end sits empty, hood up.
WALLY BECKETTE, a rather portly man in his early sixties, the school custodian, fiddles with the exposed engine.
Wally, you've been under that hood for months.  Why don't we just call a mechanic?
Wally stops what he is doing... comes out from beneath th hood... wipes his hands on his pants.
Miss Tate, I serviced B-1 Bombers in W-W-2.  This here is child's play.
So you're saying I should call a child to come give you a hand?
Wally chuckles softly, charmed by Keri like the rest of t staff.
I'm saying she'll be purring like a kitten before you know it.
There's your problem, Walter.  You don't want it to purr, you want it to start.
And she will, Miss Tate.  She will.
Keri continues toward the school.  Wally watches with admiration as she heads into the building...
(continuing) Mmmm-mmm.  If they had teachers like you when I was a boy, I'd be a rocket scientist.
Wally goes back to tinkering with the engine...
ON HATTIE SMITH, mid-sixties, dressed in a guard uniform. approaches Keri, looking very official... holds a key in hand.
Good morning, Hattie.
Went into town.  Had that duplicate key made.
Hattie hands Keri the key.
Thank you.
Hattie extends an open hand.
Thank me with two bucks.
Oh... right.
Keri digs through her pocket, produces a handful of chang gives it to Hattie.
(dripping sarcasm) Just what I wanted... more change.
Hattie heads back toward the guard house, turns back to Keri --
(continuing) And next time you lose a gate key, young lady, you'll be climbing your way out of here.
Keri holds the key to her chest.
I'll be more careful next time.
Hattie dismisses Keri with a wave of her hand, continues across campus to the guard house.
Keri smiles, places the key in her pocket and disappears inside the school...
Pouring rain.  In stark contrast to the sunny campus of Hillcrest...
EMERGENCY VEHICLES litter the landscape, lights FLASHING.
OFFICERS wrap yellow crime scene tape around the perimete keeping curious NEIGHBORS at bay...
a middle-aged police detective, eyes bloodshot from too little sleep and one too many hours in front of a compute screen, emerges from a dark Sedan... a lit cigarette dang loosely from his lips.
Carter approaches a young OFFICER standing outside the fr door --
(flashes his badge) Detective Richard Carter, Haddonfield P.D.  Detective Blake called my office...
The Officer motions to the door --
Go on in.  She's been waiting for you.
Carter heads towards the door, the Officer grabs his arm.
(continuing) You might need this...
The Officer offers him a small jar of petroleum jelly. Carter waves it away.
(continuing) Some serious shit in there, Detective.
Carter reconsiders, smears the Vaseline under each nostri heads for the house.
Carter crosses through the front door, watches as
A TEAM of latex-gloved FORENSIC SPECIALISTS
dust door and windows for fingerprints, swab at blood dro and collect carpet fibers for later analysis...
Carter crosses into the living room, winces at
sprawled across the floor in front of blood-soaked curtains... the wrought-iron poker jammed up her nose, ex through the top of her skull... a kitchen knife lies besi her...
Carter takes another hit off the cigarette, blows smoke i the room...
Double homicide.
Carter turns to see
standing behind him... mid-twenties, attractive yet approachable...
Her name's Pamela Whittington, next door neighbor to victim number two... James Howell.
Carter motions in the direction of the den where
takes snapshots of the teenage corpse.
Let me guess... he's the guy with the hockey skate for a nose ring.
crosses to Carter, extends a dixie cup in his direction -
No thanks, I'm not thirsty.
It's for your cigarette.  I prefer not to contaminate my crime scene with micropollutants.
Carter takes a final puff off the cigarette, drops it int the cup...
Why am I here?
They said on the phone you were assigned to the Meyers case.
With all due respect, detective, you can't go blaming every brutal murder in Illinois on Michael Meyers.
Pamela Whittington was a long time associate of Dr. Loomis.  Her home office was ransacked.  It was chock full of Loomis' files on Meyers.  It'd say that makes Meyers a suspect, wouldn't you?
Well, when you put it that way.
Right.  So why don't we get on with this investigation?
I like a woman who takes control.
Blake ignores the comment, crosses to the front door... Carter follows.
During the following dialogue, Blake walks Carter through crime scene reenacting the prior evening's brutal events.
Pamela entered the house and walked into the den where she discovers James Howell's body...
Carter and Blake stand in front of the mutilated face of teenage boy...
(continuing) Shaken, she returns to the front door to find the hutch blocking her exit...
ON gouges across the wood planks, forming tracks from the dining room to the front door...
(continuing) She runs to the kitchen, where she is ambushed at the back door by the killer.
Carter and Blake stand in front of the door, which is sti open.  Carter kneels down, looks at the kitchen floor...
One set of muddy shoe prints.
That don't match either of the victim's.
Carter stands up, moves to a butcher block on the counter he's starting to enjoy this dance --
She grabs a knife from the butcher block.
ON the butcher block, an empty slot where the knife once resided...
Heads to the living room...
They cross back into the living room...
Carter moves to the
covered in fingerprint powder, exposing a plethora of pri
Where, judging by the looks of the finger and palm prints, she struggles to open the window before banging on it like hell.
Unable to escape, she turns and attacks the killer, but doesn't connect.
No blood on the knife.
ON the knife, clean as a whistle...
(continuing) The killer knocks the knife out of her hand with the wrought-iron poker.
Broken blood vessels on her right forearm.
ON Pamela's arm, a bruise forming under the skin...
As which point she drops to her knees in pain...
Explaining the low height of the blood splatter on the curtains...
ON the curtains, blood stained four feet and below...
Impressive, Blake.  Where'd you learn how to do that?
Girl scouts.
Carter chuckles... she has a sense of humor, too...
The hallway is flooded with STUDENTS, books in tow...
a young seventeen, friendly eyes and a face to match.
Walking beside her is...
LINDA KANG, same age, unconcerned, full of spunk... multi body piercings, doesn't quite fit in here or anywhere...
You aced it, didn't you?
I did alright.
Linda grabs Molly's test, peeking out from her biology bo
Fuckin' A.
He gave me a fuckin' A?  Wow.
Linda punches Molly playfully in the arm.  They stop at neighboring lockers, retrieve books from inside...
AMY KRAMER approaches, book pressed against an ample ches smacking on a wad of gum...
Eye-catching good looks, a real stunner... a bit short on gray matter though --
These lockers are totally girl unfriendly.
Break another nail?
Pointer finger.  And the dance is in two days...
Life's a bitch.
The girls head down the hall...
Eddie's working late at Freeman's tonight... all alone.
I thought Eddie left for N.Y.U.?
Guess he couldn't tear himself away from me.
Guess he couldn't pass admissions.
Shut up, pinhead.
John approaches them from behind, drapes his arms around Molly...
There you are. (to Amy) You tell 'em about tonight?
I just got here.
John removes a key from his jacket pocket, drops it in Molly's hand...
What's this?
You say, "The key to my heart," and I'm gonna hurl.
Shelve the barf bag.  It's the key to the main gate.
Where'd you get it?
Swiped it from my mom's desk yesterday.
You stole it?
I borrowed it.
Party at Freeman's tonight.
I am in need of some serious partying.
Not me.
Why not?
I can't afford to get caught.
Molly, you're the resident assistant.  What are you gonna do, narc on yourself?
Students clear the hall, move inside their classrooms.
John kisses Molly on the lips...
Just meet me in front of the gate after lights out.
He takes off down the hall --
(calling after him) Wait... John...
He's gone.  A teacher guides the girls inside a classroom shuts the door...
A bevy of STUDENTS scurry about the gym making final preparations for the impending Halloween Festivals:  hang decorations on walls, carving pumpkins, spinning cob webs along refreshment tables...
ON WILL BRENNEN, a well-favored Chemistry teacher in his forties, thinning hair, more salt than pepper... supervis the action... a coffee mug in hand... his attention focus on...
sitting atop the bleachers.  Will climbs the benches, sit beside her...
What a sight for sore eyes...
He kisses her softly on the lips.
(continuing) ... and ears...
He kisses her again.
(continuing) ...and lips...
He engages her in a lingering kiss.
point and giggle at the smooching faculty members.
Keri notices, pulls away...
Will...
She motions toward the students below.
What?  They've all taken sex ed.
He leans in for another kiss, she playfully keeps him at length...
And this isn't the place for a live demonstration.
Will relents, settles for holding Keri's hand...
Aren't they doing a terrific job this year?
(distracted) Looks great.  It does.
You okay?  You seem a little off.
Nothing a good stiff drink can't fix.
Will doesn't find the humor, eyes her uneasily.
(continuing) That one always goes over big at the AA meetings.
An awkward beat, then...
It's John, isn't it?
It's always John.
Still wants to move out?
He's been living out of moving boxes for three months.
This kid just wants his freedom.
It's not going to happen.
The tighter you squeeze, the harder he'll try to break free.
Oh, please... you get that out of a fortune cookie?
Doesn't make it bad advice.
Keri manages a smile...
(continuing) God I love that smile.
Keri stands.  Will follows suit.
I'm going into town... run a few errands before dark.  Need anything?
A box of fortune cookies... I'm running out of advice.
Bye Will.
Keri heads down the bleachers.  Will watches her leave, completely enamored...
A family-owned grocery mart in the heart of Ferndale.  A dozen CUSTOMERS mingle through the aisles.
ON Keri, standing in front of a CASHIER as he rings up a dozen items...
Keri glances at the wall of tabloids in front of her, one them catches her eye --

A headline reads: "SERIAL KILLER MICHAEL MEYERS REALLY AL FROM OUTER SPACE."  Beneath the headline is a mock photo the Shape, holding the infamous mask in his hand, reveali an alien head underneath....
Keri can't help but smirk at the absurdity of it all.  Th cashier hands Keri her change...
Happy Halloween.
Keri manages a polite smile, and exits...
Keri moves down the tree-lined street, groceries tucked securely under her arm.
She pauses at a storefront window.  "KESSLER JEWELERS.  E 1963" emblazoned across the glass.
An assortment of wedding rings glimmer behind the glass.
holds her left hand up to the window, moving it slowly fr ring to ring... then she sees --
in the reflection... standing across the street, staring right through her... taunting her.  This is no alien...
heart stops... she stands frozen, totally immobile.
passes between them.
takes this opportunity to spin around.  The truck passes
I hate this fucking holiday...
Keri climbs into the driver's seat of her Ford Explorer, tosses the bag of groceries on the passenger seat...
She starts the engine...
"MR. SANDMAN" blares over the radio... scares the shit ou her.  Keri quickly changes stations... heads back to the school.
Sparsely decorated.  Scattered Chinese food containers li the counters.
On a glass dining room table, a table dozen cardboard box "DR. LOOMIS" in black sharpie scrawled across their sides
The CAMERA PANS across the table where...
sits, eyes glazed over... shuffling through a stack of photographs.
Of a young Michael Meyers playing with a fire truck in th den... running through sprinklers in the backyard... ridi horses at the county fair... no signs of the evil lurking inside.
CARTER sets the photographs aside, digs through a file bo pulls out a film canister marked "MEYERS' HOME MOVIES."
CARTER threads the Super 8 film through it, turns it on.. images of a young Michael Meyers are projected on a bare in the darkened room. CARTER settles into the recliner, fights to stay awake...

head_text.subj: THE SHAPE APPEARS IN FRONT OF THE WALL.

text: The home movies projected on his pale mask.  He moves slo toward the sleeping CARTER, a knife in his grip.
The SHAPE raises the knife to CARTER's throat, slices it ear to ear.  CARTER grabs his throat, blood gushes throug his fingers.  Then...
Gasps for air... he feels for his throat... no blood, all well.
The Super 8 films slaps against the projector, the reel n over...
CARTER catches his breath... surveys the room... he is al He picks up the phone --
(into phone) Carter.
It's Blake.  Meet me at Grand View.
Where?
The cemetery...
Yeah, alright... I'll be there in ten.
Carter hangs up the phone, massages his throat...
CAMERA PULLS BACK TO REVEAL a mannequin sporting the mask dark overalls made notorious by Michael Meyers... its arm posed high in the air, wielding a meat cleaver.
Gathered around the mannequin is the gang: Linda is in the arms of her boyfriend, SHANE McCLOUD... a tall and spindly teen, book smart and street dumb...
John riffles through a rack of Halloween costumes.  Molly leans against a nearby counter... she checks her watch, visibly uncomfortable being here at all.
EDDIE CATERO, two years out of high school and still wear his letterman jacket, 'Nuff said.
He stands proudly by his display, nursing a beer... his a draped around Amy, who's painting her nails with a nail polish plucked from a nearby display...
(re: the display) Pretty wicked, huh?
I think it's twisted.
This coming from the girl with a stake through her tongue.
You're glorifying the big creep.
Besides, it's historically inaccurate.
What the fuck are you talking about?
Michael Meyers never used a meat cleaver.  It was a butcher knife.
Who are you, the serial killer police?  What difference does it make?
It's not historically accurate, that's all.
He could be holding a swizzle stick, it still gives me the willies.
Don't worry... I hear he only kills virgins.
Another historical inaccuracy.
Would somebody shut this guy up?
Come on, we better get back before Mrs. Sullivan makes her rounds.
Linda looks at her watch.
Oh, shit.  Molly's right.  It's eleven-thirty.
The gang heads for the front door...
You guys go on.  Eddie's gonna take me back after he closes up.
Bells hanging from the door JINGLE as they exit...  John turns to them as he leaves --
Condoms are on aisle four...
Out.
Eddie pushes John out the door, shuts it behind him...
The group moves down the deserted street, headed for Hillcrest.  John's arm around Molly.  Shane's around Lind
Being hung on the front door.
CAMERA PULLS BACK TO REVEAL Amy, holds up her newly polis nails to Eddie...
How do you like the color?  It's called "Bloodshed Red."
Yeah, yeah... looks good...
Eddie grabs Amy by the waist, pulls her in... kisses her passionately.
(continuing) Let's go in back and check out the "inventory."
Mmmmm, sounds good.
Eddie and Amy head to the --
Eddie and Amy get hot and heavy amongst a room full of cardboard boxes, Halloween costumes, and mask...
As Eddie prepares to do the one-hand bra release...
The bells hung on the front door chime.
Shit.  Can't people read?  Don't move.  I'll be right back.
Eddie exits, leaving behind a half-naked Amy.
Eddie moves toward the front of the store, heads down the center aisle.  He hears the SHUFFLING OF FEET in the aisl next to him...
(calling off) Hey, we're closed!
Eddie rounds the corner, runs smack into --
(continuing) Shit!
It's only the mannequin, which isn't where Eddie left it. arm poised high in the air, knife missing.
Eddie turns around to see --
standing right behind him, wielding the meat cleaver. Eddie's seeing double...
What the hell...
The Shape attacks, slices through his skull with the meat cleaver...
As Amy sifts through a box of scary masks, she hears...
outside the door... she throws on her blouse, peeks outsi
Eddie?
(continuing) Damnit, Eddie!  Stop fooling around.
Still nothing... Amy cautiously moves into the store, loo for her missing partner... she passes
If you think you're gettin' any after this, you're dead wrong.
She stumbles, looks down to reveal...
sprawled on the floor, the meat cleaver buried in the mid of his forehead... eyes wide open in terror!
Amy SCREAMS... can barely stand... she stumbles to the fr of the door... it's locked! The Michael Meyers mannequin behind her comes to life, be to move toward her...
Amy beats frantically on the glass door, struggling to fr the lock... she turns to see...
closing in behind her... she SCREAMS.
The SHAPE attacks, grabs Amy by the back of the neck... pushes her face through the glass door, cuts it to bits..
He lifts Amy high into the air, she struggles to free herself... the Shape impales her body on a large shard of glass.
ON Amy's feet... dangling a foot off the ground... then..
Her body goes completely limp... lifeless.
ON Amy's hand... blood cascades down her fingers, matches shade of her nail polish...
The SHAPE looks at her breathless body quizzically...
A well manicured graveyard... lush green lawns, thriving trees, and patches of blooming flowers...
FRED WILLIAMS, an elderly caretaker, leads Carter and Bla through the darkened cemetery... a flashlight illuminatin their path.
You take all your dates here. Blake?
Only the real stiffs.
I can be real stiff.
Charming.
Hey!  Watch my geraniums.
Carter looks down at his feet, finds himself standing in middle of a group of flowers... he quickly hops back onto grass...
(continuing) Beautiful, aren't they?  Rotting corpses make the best fertilizer, ya' know.  Especially those Irish folk.  They push up the daises like a son-of-a-bitch...
I'll remember that.
Hell, I can tell you where every Mick is buried by the ground cover growing above 'em.
Fred shines his flashlight on a distant grave.
(continuing) Irish... (shining the beam on another grave) ...Irish...
They stop in front of a gravesite... TOMBSTONE missing... patchy grass covers the grave.
(continuing) Never could get anything to grow cover this one...
And you're sure this is Laurie Strode's grave?
Sure as I'm standing here.
Fred shines the beam of the flashlight on an adjacent headstone...
(continuing) Buried her daughter right next to her not too long ago.  You don't suppose that Meyers fella took the tombstone?
Probably just a couple of kids playing a Halloween prank.
Tee-peeing a house, yes.  A bag of burning shit on a porch, maybe. Digging up tombstone?  I don't think so.
Carter shrugs his shoulders, take a drag off his cigarett
I'm going to bed.
Carter heads back to his car.  Blake runs after him...
That's it?
Care to join me?
Come on, Carter.  You know it's Michael.
What do you want me to do, put out an A.P.B. on a man in overalls wearing a white mask dragging a headstone?
Yes.
Sweet dreams, Blake.
Carter climbs into his car, heads for home...
Keri tosses and turns in her bed, unable to exorcise the demons from her mind... eyes wide open, watches the moonl cast the shadows of dancing leaves on the ceiling above h
Then, the shadow of something altogether unnatural appear above her...
hair tattered and tousled by the wind.
ON Keri lying frozen in fear, eyes unblinking.
grows larger, nearly engulfs the entire ceiling... then suddenly disappears from view... the dancing leaves retur
A noise from outside her window.  FOOTSTEPS quickly make their way around the house...
Keri jumps out of her skin, holds her breath...
A JIGGLING SOUND emanates from the living room, as if someone's trying to get in through the front door...
Keri jumps out of her bed, slides a metal box out from un the bed... pulls a SMITH AND WESSON from inside... heads for --
Keri moves silently through the hallway into the living r gun at the ready... hands trembling... eyes locked on the front door as --
slowly twists and turns... the SHADOW of a man behind the curtain of the window flanking the side of the door.
raises the gun... uses both hands to steady her aim... he breathing becoming more shallow with each passing second.
swings open revealing...
house key in hand... busted.
lowers the gun, fights back in tears...
John closes the door... if he's surprised that his mother pointing a gun in his face, he doesn't show it...
Shit, John!  What the hell were you doing out there?!
Nothing.
You're kidding with that answer, right?
I just went for a walk.  It's no big deal.
Wrong.  There are rules in this house and you're going to follow them whether you like it or not.
Or what?  You're gonna shoot me?
It's an option.
Well, maybe if you'd let me live in the dorms, I wouldn't have to sneak out to spend time with my friends.
Oh, so now it's my fault?
Just forget it...
John storms down the hall, disappears into his bedroom... slams the door behind him.
Keri enters the room, passes by the window... glances out into the night and sees --
standing between sheets that blow in the clothesline.
closes her eyes, takes a deep breath... opens them... now both the Shape and the sheets blowing in the clothesline VANISHED.
Keri substituting for the absentee English Lit teacher. Elliot.
A STUDENT has just finished her oral report and heads bac her seat.
Keri stands, crosses to the chalkboard --
I'm sure Mr. Elliot will go over this when he returns on Monday, but Julie hit on a very important aspect of Virgil's "The Aeniad."
She scrawls the word "FATE" across its surface...

(continuing) F-A-T-E.  Fate.  The Romans believed in the three goddesses of Fate, called "the Fate."  Nona, Decuma, and Morta.  These goddesses determined your fate. They were to blame when things went wrong, and were to be praised when --
Keri passes in front of the classroom, glances out the wi and sees --
standing behind the gates of the academy, waiting patient for his chance... eyes burning a hold right through her.
wait for Keri to complete her thought... mumble softly amongst themselves...
closes her eyes for a moment, takes a deep breath... look outside again... the Shape is STILL THERE!
The students make a mad dash for the hall.
moves swiftly through the throng of students, pushing bewildered pupils aside as she makes her way to the schoo entrance...
Keri emerges from the building, moves across the campus toward the iron gates... runs smack into --
throws his arms around her waist...
Whoa... what's the hurry?  I'm not going anywhere...
Keri doesn't respond, is too busy looking over Will's shoulder --
KERI'S POV of the gate... the SHAPE has once again disappeared.
Keri eyes the perimeter of the campus, searching for her lost brother.
(continuing) Hey, you alright?
(distracted) What?
What are you looking at?
I'm fine.  I just need to lie down...
Keri breaks free from Will's grip, heads toward the facul housing, determined.  Will watches her leave, face laced concern...
Keri climbs atop a foot stool, retrieves a BOTTLE of Vodk concealed behind bags of flour on the top shelf of the pantry...
She spins off the top... brings the lip of the bottle to mouth, hands trembling...
She stops short of taking the drink, bring the bottle dow from her lips...
Keri climbs off the foot stool, crosses to the kitchen si and pours the Vodka down the drain...
Blake sits behind her desk leafing through the double homicide case file, looking for some stone that's been le unturned...
She removes a FILE FOLDER from an evidence bag, "KERI TAT in type across the index tape...
Blake opens it... still empty.
The light from her desk lamp falls across the open folder reveals a series of indentations in the left hand corner the manilla paper...
struggles to make out the ghost writing... grabs a pencil moves the side of the lead swiftly across the folder...
The numbers pop out against the shaded background...
jots the numbers down on a nearby pad.

Blake tries formatting the numbers into a Social Security number: "608-92-44325" too many numbers.  She scratches i out... She tries again... puts parenthesis around the first thre numbers and a dash after the sixth number:  "(608) 924- 4325"  -- BINGO.  A telephone number...
picks up the telephone, dials the number...
Hillcrest Academy, may I help you?
from the "Haddonfield Leader" pinned to a large BULLETIN BOARD, tales of the Michael Meyers' slayings splattered across the headlines.
A TELEPHONE RINGS in the b.g.
CAMERA PANS ACROSS the board, finds...
of Meyers' slain victims... bloody, graphic images assaul the eye.
CAMERA PULLS BACK to reveal we are in --
Carter sits beneath a desk... searches for the phone, fin it buried beneath a sea of reports --
(into phone) Carter.
It's Blake.  How do you feel about Wisconsin?
ON Carter's puzzled expression...
parked across the street, filled to capacity with student
ON John watching from outside the school bus as
strings yellow crime scene tape across the front of the drugstore.
stands next to John, arm around his waist... watching curiously...
leans against the side of the bus next to Shane...
Look, they're staring right at us.
(to John) You think your mom knows we snuck out last night?
Nah, I didn't tell her where I went.
Is that all you guys can think about?  Amy never came back last night.  Maybe she's in trouble.
Better her than me.
You're unbelievable.
Linda's right.  I have Yale to think about.  Amy's going to the Barbizon School of Beauty -- if they let her retake her boards...
ON BRUCE CLARK, a young deputy ducks under the yellow tap approaches...
stands in front of a squad car, craning her neck to get a look at the proceedings...
Bruce... what's going on?  The kids are here to pick out their costumes for the festival.
Better take 'em to Virgil's downtown.  We got a dead body in there.
Keri's heart skips a beat, she tries to digest the news..
A dead body?
It's Amy Kramer.
My god...
Pretty messy.  Parents have already been notified.  Our office has been trying to get a hold of you...
Keri fears the worse, tries to hold herself together...
Do you know who did this?
Well, Eddie Catero didn't show up for work this morning... parents say he never came home last night. Car's still missing.
(wishful) Think Eddie had something to do with it?
Doesn't look good.
Deputy Clark turns in the direction of the bus...
(continuing) You best keep those students locked behind those gates of yours... got ourselves a cold-blooded killer on the loose.
Night.  Wind assaults the trees.  Lights illuminate a doz dorm windows.
A compact CAR pulls up behind the gates, high beams illuminating the...
There is an entrance on either side of the guard house... inside sits Hattie.
She cups her hands over her eyes, protecting them from th glare of the auto's headlights.  She checks --
embedded in the console in front of her... black and whit image of the car idling outside the gates illuminates the screen.
ON Hattie, unable to make out the identity of the driver. She steps out of the guard house...
Through the gate, she sees a figure slumped behind the wheel...
(calling off) Who's there?
No response.
(continuing) Please identify yourself, young man.
Still nothing.  Hattie doesn't know what to do.

She opens the gate with her gate key and walks through... approaches the car.  The trees rustle nearby.  She takes look, spooking herself.  It is, after all, Halloween. She crosses to the driver's side window... looks inside t find the body of --
the costume shop victim, slouched behind the wheel... fac bloodied mess.
My Lord...
Hattie stumbles backward... she's doesn't see THE SHAPE p through the open gates behind her.
She crosses back to the --
Hattie quickly presses a BUTTON on the console in front o her, automatically closing the wrought iron gates outside
stands at the entrance to the left of guard house.  Hatti back to him.
She picks up the phone... no dial tone.  She jiggles the receiver... comes up short.
CLINK.  A noise from outside.
Hattie spins around, faces the left entrance... no one in sight.
(softly) Hello?
No answer.  Hattie crosses to the left entrance, shuts th door... throws the bolt.
appears behind Hattie... now standing at the entrance to right of the guard house.
CLINK.  Another noise, source unknown...
Hattie spins around, faces the right entrance... the Shap has vanished.

Hattie crosses to the right entrance, shuts the door... l it.  Now secured safely inside the guard house, Hattie crosses to a CB Radio... She turns it on... dials the emergency channel... is distracted by --
outside the gates... its headlights suddenly extinguish.
ON Hattie, squints through through window in the car's direction...
emerges from the shadows behind her... wraps the CB cord around her neck... Hattie struggles to free herself... he face pressed up against the glass...
The Shape brandishes a knife... stabs her repeatedly in t back... ends the struggle.
Wally, the custodian, climbs the four flights of stairs t the massive bell partially enclosed at its top... he tugs the rope dangling from the bell...
Its sound resonating across the campus.
The windows, once lit, are now extinguished, leaving the dorms shrouded in total darkness... lights out.
The sound of the ringing bell echoes softly through the room...
Molly lies in her bed, unable to sleep, eyes to the ceiling... her pajama clad body partially covered by a sh
lying beside Molly's bed, also asleep.
Molly hears the RUSTLING of bushes outside her window... turns in its direction to see --
moving forcefully, their branches scratching wildly again glass...
sits up in bed, her eyes glued to the window... she slowl gets out of bed, moves toward it... leans against the windowpane.
of the campus, bathed in moonlight... wind howls through trees... leaves scurry across the grounds.
A hand raps on her window.  Molly jumps out of her skin.
standing outside her window, motions her to open it.  She does, sticks her head out...
(whispering) What are you doing here?!
(whispering) I came to see you.
I can see that. (a beat) Why?
Can I come in?
Are you crazy?  You'll get caught.
Then you come out here.
Then I'll get caught.
(louder) Well, I'm not going until I talk to you.
Alright.  I'll come out.  Just be quiet.
Molly and John meander through the wooded acreage along t perimeter of the campus, hand-in-hand... the school build completely obfuscated by the surrounding foliage.
You really think Eddie killed her?
You saw that Michael Meyers display.  You've got to be pretty twisted to come up with something like that.
I guess.  It's just hard to believe.
appears behind them in the distance, standing beside a tree... watching... waiting.  It seems as though with eac cut the SHAPE moves closer...
You look kind of cold.
I'm okay.
Here, take my jacket.
John takes off his letterman jacket, drapes it over her shoulders...
The SHAPE disappears from view, into the thicket.
(continuing) Better?
Yeah.
John gazes into Molly's eyes, her moves in closer... they engage in a passionate kiss... John's hands begin to find there way up her blouse when --
grabs them by the back of their necks, pulls them to thei feet!  Shit!  Molly SCREAMS... the CAMERA PULLS BACK TO REVEAL...
with a firm grip on them both, a disapproving look painte across her face.
All right... fun's over.
Keri moves across the campus, back to the school... Molly John in tow.  They pass the group of faculty houses...
(to John) Go take a cold shower... I'll deal with you later.
John heads for his house, waves good-bye to Molly... she waves back sheepishly.
Keri and Molly continue toward the dorms...
(continuing) Molly, of all the people... if I can't trust my resident assistant, then what?
I know.  I'm really, really sorry, Miss Tate.  Please let me keep the job... it's the only way I can afford to stay here.
Okay, tell you what... you can still be the school R.A., but no dance tomorrow night.
(relieved) Okay... thank you.
Molly gives Keri a hug...
Something tells me I won't get the same reaction when I tell John...
The two are completely unaware of...
watching from the thicket, the moonlight reflected off hi pale white mask.
STUDENTS scurry from their dorms to the adjacent school building, racing to make it to their a.m. classes on time
SUPER the legend:  "October 31st.  Halloween."
A group of students take laps in the indoor swimming pool beneath the retracted gymnasium floor.
The gym is decorated for the Halloween festival that nigh
Their coach, MRS. ROCKWELL, supervises from poolside, whi dangling around her neck.
ON Molly, Linda, and SARAH LOCKE, the resident gossip wit beauty pageant good looks, as they complete their final l
They congregate in the shallow end, their goggles perched their heads...
I feel like everyone's staring at me.
News travels fast.  It's all over school about you and John getting busted in the woods by Miss Tate.
Don't suppose you had anything to do with that, motor mouth.
Shut up, freak.
Mrs. Rockwell blows her WHISTLE... the girls in the pool for her instruction.
Alright, I know you girls have the big Halloween dance tonight, so I'm letting you go ten minutes early today.
(under her breath) How generous of her.
Molly, Linda, and Sarah start to climb out of the pool...
Sarah, since you took it upon yourself to arrive ten minutes late today, you can stay the extra ten minutes.
But Mrs. Rockwell...
Use the time to practice your drive.  You looked real sloppy out there today.
Ooooh, busted.
Big time.  And news travels fast. Wouldn't be surprised if the whole school knows about this one by tonight.
Sarah flips them the finger...
Smile at the birdie, ladies.
Molly and Linda head toward the locker room...
Sarah Locke.  What a major bitch. You know she waxes her stomach?
Molly and Linda exit the gymnasium...

ON Sarah as she climbs out of the pool... walks to the di board on the other end of the deserted gym... places the goggles over her eyes... She dives into the water... swims underwater toward the shallow end... she heads toward the surface...
The SHAPE is standing poolside... his image warped by the rolling water, bobbing and swaying with the current.
Sarah breaks through the surface of the water, catches he breath... throws off her goggles, scans the gym...
Empty.  Not a soul in sight.
Sarah shrugs it off, climbs back out of the pool... heads the diving board...
She dives into the water... as she emerges in the shallow the lights in the gym extinguish... leaving her in darkne
(calling out) Hey!  There's someone in here!
No response.  Sarah moves toward the stairs...
(continuing) Hell-o!  I'm in here!
She grabs the railing, starts to pull herself out of the pool, when suddenly...

head_text.subj: THE SHAPE GRABS HER BY THE NECK.

text: Pushes her back into the pool... holds her head under the water... her arms flail wildly as she struggles for breat
The Shape flashes a knife... slices into flesh...
Sarah's body goes limp... the SHAPE releases her... her lifeless body floats face down in the bloody water.
The SHAPE has disappeared from view.
The gym floor begins to close over the pool, covering the floating corpse inside of it.
Keri moves across campus, notices --
open to the single lane road exiting the school.
Keri eyes the GUARDHOUSE that sits at the entrance, indig
Keri enters, the guard house is empty...
(calling off) Hattie?
She's nowhere in sight...
(continuing) Now where is she?
Keri pushes a BUTTON on the console in front of her.
slowly begin to close...
exits the guard house, closes the door behind her... head back to the school.
sits on the console, filled with a deep red liquid...
A drop of blood falls from
Blood soaks the drop-ceiling... Hattie's corpse hidden fr view.
The GATES SHUT tight...
Keri walks into her office, shuts the door behind her... turns to find
seated in front of her desk... Blake stands beside him, looking out the office window...
Keri jumps at the sight of the uninvited guests --
(startled) Shit!
Carter stands, takes one look at her and knows he's hit t jackpot...
I'll be damned.
Do I know you?
We're sorry to startle you, Miss Tate.
The door was open, so we let ourselves in.
I can see that.  Who are you?
Carter flashes a smile, then his badge...
Detective Carter from the Haddonfield P.D.
Toni Blake from Langley P.D.
Keri knows exactly why they're here, her dual lives are crossing paths... they've found little sister.
Mind if we sit down?
I'd prefer you didn't.  I'm very busy.
Okay, then how 'bout we ask you a few questions?
Detective...
Carter.
... I think it would be best if you both left.
Might want to stop and think about the safety of your students, Miss Tate.
I never stop thinking about it, Detective. (pointing out the window) The only way in or out of this school is through that gate, and it is secured at all times.
Funny, we just drove right in.
Well, I can assure you, it won't happen again.  Thanks for your concern.  Goodbye.
Carter starts out... turns back toward Keri.
Has anyone ever told you, you bear a striking resemblance to Laurie Strode?
Keri glares at him for a beat... the walls around her are collapsing.
Never heard of her.
Blake removes a business card from her pocket, a phone nu scribbled across its face.  She places it on the desk...
The Ferndale P.D. is setting up a roadblock couple miles down the road.  They think they're looking for a jealous boyfriend gone mad... I think differently.  We can protect you..
Keri doesn't flinch, motions toward the door.  Carter and Blake start out --
You can't stop him.
Carter stops, turns back toward her...
Not without some help.
Carter and Blake exit, shut the door behind them...
Carter and Blake in a rental car to the side of the road outside the gates.
Blake emerges from the passenger side... Carter tosses he walkie-talkie...
Don't be a stranger...
Carter pulls away from the school...
Blake hooks the walkie-talkie to her side, heads back int the campus, passes --
hidden behind the bushes, Eddie's rotting corpse locked inside...
Lots of nubile young bodies moving to and fro, changing o of sweaty gym clothes into dry attire.
ON Molly, standing in front of a fogged-up mirror, straig from the shower... towel tucked firmly around her chest. Linda stands to her right, putting on her make-up... also a towel.
Shane's going as a condom.
I thought you were allergic to latex.
I'll pop a Benadryl.
You think they'll let him in dressed like that?
Oh, they're so stupid... I'll just tell them he's going as a sausage casing.
Linda swipes her palm across the fogged-up mirror, wiping away the steam...
ON the MIRROR.  In its reflection we see Molly and Linda. then --
appears from the cloud of steam behind them!
Other STUDENTS spot the intruder, run SCREAMING from the locker room.
The SHAPE grabs Linda from behind... wields a knife... sl her throat... blood cascades down her neck, 'blemishes th towel around her bust.
ON Molly, immobile.  Terrified.  Unable to scream.
lifeless body drops to the floor... eyes wide open in ter
shifts his attention to
gets her legs back, runs like hell... runs smack into
at the locker room entrance... grabs Molly in her arms.
Whoa.  What's going on in there?
Molly is on the verge of hysterics --
Linda!  He killed Linda!
Who?!
Michael Meyers!
Keri darts into the locker room...
(continuing) Miss Tate, wait!
Molly follows her, stands in the relative safety of the doorway... Keri walks in to find --
standing above Linda's lifeless body... knife raised high the air, dripping blood.
ON Keri, her legs buckle... she struggles to stay standin
Michael, nooooooo!
Then, an even more bizarre sight --
starts to CHUCKLE... his shoulders bobbing up and down... bending over slightly at the waist.
lifeless body starts trembling with laughter.
reaches up to his mask, pulls it off... it's JOHN!
That was classic... (imitating Keri) "Michael, nooooooo!"
sits up, licks some blood off her fingers.
Mmmm.  Anyone got some French fries?
John and Linda cracks up.
ON Keri, mortified... the sight of her son dressed like h homicidal uncle is almost too much for her to bear...
John and Linda are too busy revealing in their prank to notice...
(continuing) Molly, you should have seen your face...
Keri crosses over to John... SLAPS him across the face, h John reels, probably the first time Keri's laid a hand on him...
Home... NOW!
Keri grabs John by the arm, pushes him past Molly...
John sits on the sofa.  Will stands behind him... neither sure exactly what they're doing there.
Keri paces in front of them...
I'm sorry, alright?  It was just a stupid joke.
Will, sit down...
Will does.
(continuing) There's something I have to tell you both.  It's going to sound strange...
What?
My name hasn't always been Keri Tate.  It was once Laurie Strode.
You're right.  It does sound strange.
You some kind of fugitive or something?
I was trying to get away from someone.
Who?
Michael Meyers.
The serial killer?
He's my brother.
Now you're joking, right?
Afraid not.  You can pick your friends, but you can't pick your family.
Keri, have you been...
Will mimes taking a drink from a bottle...
No, Will, this isn't the alcohol talking.  It's the truth.
I can't believe this is happening.
Shit happens.
Wait a minute... slow down... you're telling me Michael Meyers is my uncle?
Yes.
Any other psychotic relatives I should know about?  Jason?  Freddy Krueger?
No.
Why didn't you tell me?
I was trying to protect you from this...
Keri holds up this trademark Halloween mask, a tuft of ha tightly in her grip...
John crosses to the front door, opens it...
(continuing) Where are you going?
I don't know.
John exits.  Keri starts after him, Will grabs her by the arm...
You just dropped a shitload on him... give him some time to digest it.
Are you going to leave, too?
Never.
Keri nuzzles her head against Will's chest...
(continuing) So you're really Michael Meyers' sister?
Yeah.
Do we have to invite him to the wedding?
Keri laughs, more out of relief than anything...
A couple of Ferndale P.D. SQUAD CARS flank either side of road.
lined up across the asphalt deny access to the roadway leading to Hillcrest.
ON Carter, leaning against a squad car.  Deputy Clark sta next to him.  Carter lights up a cigarette...
Don't worry, Detective.  No one's getting up to that school.
And this is the only way up to Hillcrest?
Sure is.  Unless your boy can fly.
I hope not.
Deputy Clark laughs, Carter doesn't... just takes another drag off his cigarette...
Darkness falls... Halloween night.
make their way inside the gymnasium.
Freshman, armed with cartons of eggs and rolls of toilet paper, emerge stealthily from the wooded acreage... they attack the Hillcrest Administrative Building.
The school custodian heads for the bell tower... spots th young punks across campus defacing what he works so hard preserve.
He takes off in their direction.
(calling off) Hey, you kids!  Knock that off! Get over here!
The boys see Wally headed in their direction... they scramble, head back for the woods... a few of them throw in Wally's direction.
Wally makes it about halfway across campus before his old ticker kicks in... he has to stop... catches his breath.
(continuing) Damn kids.
Wally turns around, heads back to the bell tower.
One by one the freshman disappear into the thicket... one the boys runs smack into...
The boys stares up at him, startled... he darts after his friends... the SHAPE continues toward Hillcrest.
Molly sits on the windowpane, her forehead pressed agains the glass.  Lurch, the dog, lies across her bed.

A view of the entire campus.  Couples make their way acro the grounds, move inside the gymnasium. Molly lets out a sigh, wishes that were her and John... s continues to stare longingly out the window...
ON Wally as he moves to the bell tower, disappears inside He is followed by...
ON Molly.  She sits up, takes notice... watches as the SH moves inside the bell tower, then suddenly...
grabs Molly by the shoulders... spins her around, reveali
in full "Bride of Frankenstein" costume.
BLAAAAAGGGHHHHH!
Shit, Linda!
You're so easy...
Wasn't scaring the hell out of me once today enough?!
Nope.  Hey, you think I'll win scariest costume?
Linda, you are without a doubt the scariest person on campus.
Thanks!
Where's Shane?
Condom Boy is waiting for me in the cafeteria.
But the dance is in the gymnasium.
Very insightful.
Echoes across the campus.
(continuing) Let the party begin.
Have enough fun for the both of us.
Oh, don't be such a victim.
Linda produces a couple of shot bottles from her purse, tosses them on the bed.
(continuing) Here.  Drink a couple of these. It'll putcha in a much better mood.  Ta-ta.
Linda exits.  The bell continues to ring.  Molly sits on bed, pats Lurch on the head.
Guess it's just you and me, boy.
The bell stops ringing abruptly.  Molly turns her attenti back to the window...
At the top of the bell tower... the SHAPE stands beside t massive bell... staring in Molly's direction, looking rig through her.
Molly gasps softly.  She looks down below and sees...
leave the dormitory, heads for the cafeteria.  Molly look back up to the bell tower... the SHAPE has vanished.
Just some idiot in a costume...
Molly sits back on her bed, uses Lurch as a pillow... Mol picks up one of the shot bottles, twists off the lid.
(continuing) Let the party begin.
Molly takes a swig from the bottle.  She shudders, her so expression says it all...
Dark and abandoned.  THE CAMERA PANS across a bevy of emp tables and chairs to reveal...
liplocked, hands all over each other.  Linda sits on the of a table.
Shane, dressed as a condom, stands between her legs.
watches from the kitchen, illuminated only by the light f a nearby soda machine.
Shane pushes Linda down onto the table, starts to unbutto her blouse...
Wait.
What is it?
I have to pee.
Can't you hold it?
Can't you?
Linda pushes Shane off her, heads for the restroom.  She passes the kitchen area... the SHAPE is nowhere in sight.
Linda enters the bathroom...
Linda crosses to a shall, tugs on the door... it's locked She knocks on the door.
Somebody in there?
No answer.  She pulls at it again... still doesn't budge.
(continuing) Hellooooo.
She kneels down on the ground, peers under the door.  Not
She stands back up... shrugs it off... moves to the next stall and goes inside, closing the door behind her.
As Linda takes care of "business."
(singing) IF YOU THINK I'M SEXY. AND YOU WANT MY BODY. COME ON, BABY.  LET ME KNOW.
The toilet flushes.  Linda emerges from the stall, crosse the mirror... checks her make-up.
Linda admires her reflection... not noticing the stall do which was previously locked is now opened.
She smiles at herself, licks her teeth, then exits to the hallway.
Linda emerges from the bathroom... she heads toward the center of the room...
Empty.  No sign of Shane anywhere.
(calling off) Shane?
Linda moves into the kitchen area where...
emerges from the shadows, attacks Linda... grabs her by t throat, lifts her into the air... Her head hits the pot rack hanging above her... pots and drop to the tile floor below...
Linda flails her arms and legs, desperately trying to fre herself form the SHAPE'S grasp...
She kicks the refrigerator door behind her... it swings o to reveal...
Asphyxiated, his condom hat pulled down over his head... corpse topples out of her refrigerator, falls onto the floor...
flicks the switch on a nearby MEAT SLICER, it WHIRS to li
The Shape forces Linda's head against the slicer... she struggles furiously as her cheek approaches the spinning blade...
everywhere as Linda is carved into quarter-inch slices...
VARIOUS SHOTS of the empty campus, all the students now congregated inside the gymnasium.
The pulsating beat of faint dance MUSIC drifts across the grounds.
The festival is in full swing... jam packed with costumed couples dancing across the floor.  CHAPERONES line the wa
leans against the refreshment table, sans costume.  Arms folded... there in body, mind elsewhere.
approaches her, dressed as Count Dracula.  He offers Keri glass of punch...
(as Dracula) May I offer you some fresh blood? I squeezed it myself.
Keri glances at him, not amused...
Not a real fan of Halloween humor, Will.
(realizing) Oh, right.  Sorry.
I'm gonna head back to the office... finish up some things.
Can't it wait till Monday?  I thought maybe we could dance... (as Dracula) I'm very light of my feet.
Keri manages a sincere smile, gives him a kiss...
Thanks, but I'm not much in the mood for dancing.  Enjoy the party... you did a great job.
Keri heads for the exit, Will watches her leave...
on the bedside table, next to two other shot bottles... untouched.  CAMERA PANS to the bed where...
lies, fully clothed... facing the ceiling.  Eyes wide ope thinking of the night that could have been...
ON Lurch, lying on the floor beside the bed... he sits up his eyes focused on...
Its door slightly ajar...  the lights on inside.  Somethi inside catches Lurch's attention... he GROWLS.

Light seeps out from the cracks in the open door, illumin the sleeves of several hanging blouses.

Wall-to-wall clothes hang from wooden dowels... Molly pal the lightswitch, flicks off the light.
Molly closes the door, tight... heads to the bathroom dow the hall, Lurch follows her out.

of the gymnasium... one of the FRESHMEN pulls a thick thr foot long CHAIN from his duffel bag... wraps it around th door handles... he produces a PADLOCK, hooks it through t loops of the chain... snaps it shut, locked tight.

full of confusion, flushes with fear.

emerges from her room... heads down the hall.

steps back into the doorway, looks into the room.

projected on the wall, it betrays her.

Hung above a large red button.  THE CAMERA PULLS BACK TO REVEAL the freshman, who snuck in earlier, poised beneath it... He punches the button, then pops it off and puts it in hi pocket... he darts for the front entrance.

The students part like the Red Sea, hooting and hollering the pool beneath them is revealed.
The freshman flies out of the gym, slams the doors shut behind him... his schoolmate chains the doors, locks them with a padlock.  They dart for the woods, passing...
stumbles towards them, her pants bloodied.  She SCREAMS, tries to get their attention... they disappear into the thicket.
She moves to the rear of the gymnasium, bangs on the chai doors... SCREAMS for help, looks over her shoulder to see
headed straight for her.  She hobbles to the front entran bangs on the door...

The SHAPE closes in.

floating, face down in the pool... water tainted bright r with her blood, illuminated by the pool light.

The mood suddenly changes... the SCREAMS of excitement quickly turn into SHRIEKS of horror.  Bedlam ensues... Frightened students scramble toward the entrance, knockin party goers into the pool... trampling over others.
Students stack up against the doors, pounding furiously.. trying to get out.
tries to calm the petrified party-goers...

from outside her office.  Keri crosses to the window...

Molly?

spiraling high above her.  She hobbles up the stairway, grunting in agony...

three flights down, begins its climb up the stairs.  Moll picks up the pace...

to swing... BUT there is no sound!

stuffed up inside of it, preventing the clapper from stri the bell.

approaches the top of the stairway... a FIGURE emerges, it's...

Running furiously across the campus... trying desperately reach the bell tower in time...

NOOOOOOOOO!

ON THE GYMNASIUM DOORS, the weight of the wooden bench po the chains wrapped around the handles, the doors fly open
watches as crazed STUDENTS pour out of the gymnasium, hea for the parked buses across campus...
STUDENTS spot Molly dangling from the bell tower... SCREA of terror echo across campus...

(realizing) John...

being filled to capacity with screaming teens...
leads the charge of getting all students safely aboard.
manages to find John amongst the throng...
John!
Mother and son reunite...
He found you, didn't he?
Get on the bus.
Where's Molly?  She's not in her room...
Just get on the bus.
I'm not leaving without her.
John, you can't help her now.
What?  Where is she?
John...
Keri's at a loss for words, it's written all over her fac
Oh, God... no... not Molly.
Please, get on the bus...
John hesitates for a beat... climbs into the bus, takes a window seat...
crosses to Keri, hugs her tight...
Keri, you all right?
We've got to get these kids out of here...
I'll make sure there's no kids left in the dorms...
dashes toward the dorms...
climbs aboard the bus, stands next to the driver... waits impatiently for Will to return.
The BUSES are on the move... leaving the academy single file...
Watching from inside his bus as it prepares to leave...
Waves to John through the window, knows this may be the l time she ever sees him.
She turns to the driver --
You go ahead.  Will and I will follow you in my car.
The DRIVER nods in agreement...
Keri gets off the bus, watches as the last bus drives thr the open gates of the academy...
Keri crosses to the dorms, disappears inside --
Keri moves noiselessly down the hallway... searching for sign of Will... holding her breath with every door she ch behind...

seeping through the cracks of a swinging door leading to dorm's kitchenette.
crosses to the swinging door, slowly pushes it open to reveal --
his whole upper torso shoved into the oven, clothes ablaz

ON WILL.  Hair singed-off his head, his face a mangled ma of burning flesh, mouth agape in horror...
Oh, God, Will...
Keri kneels down beside him, helpless... filled with rage
The kitchen door swings violently to and fro... Keri spin around, startled by --

Get off me...
The dog's mood changes suddenly: he stops licking Keri an GROWLS ferociously at something behind her...

standing above her, comes down on her with a knife... mak contact, slices her shoulder wide open.
scrambles to her feet, grabs a pot off the stove... swing the SHAPE.

Her body sprawled across Keri's bed, THROAT SLIT from ear ear... a TOMBSTONE in lieu of a headboard, "LAURIE STRODE carved into stone.
You son of a bitch!
The fury wells inside of her.  Keri crosses to the bed, d to her knees... pulls out the metal box underneath the mattress... opens it... IT'S EMPTY!
(continuing) Shit!
Keri runs from the house, determined... makes her way acr campus to --
Keri crosses to the console, pushes the BUTTON that contr the gate... it begins to close slowly.
Hattie's body falls from the drop-ceiling above, lands ri on top of Keri.  Shit.  Keri throws the bloody corpse off her.
She looks around the room... zeroes in on the large CB RADIO... she picks it up and SMASHES it against the console... over and over again... sparks fly... the gate permanently closed.
Keri reaches down, pulls Hattie's key ring from her body. moves outside.
Keri moves to the gate... locks it using Hattie's keys, t tosses them over the gate into the brush.
(calling off) Time to put an end to this nightmare, motherfucker!
Keri heads back toward the school.
Deputy Clark lies on the hood of his patrol car, hat over face... catching some z's.  Carter stands by the wooden barriers, spots --
speeding toward the roadblock, headed for the small town below...

Deputy Clark is awakened by the approaching caravan.  Car waves down a bus, moves to the door --

We're evacuating the school. Been two murders up there tonight. Killer's still on the loose...
Goddamnit!

(calling off) Call for back-up!

Carter and Deputy Clark climb into the patrol car, headed the school...
Carter grabs his walkie-talkie, barks into it --
Blake, what's going on up there!
still hooked to the side of her lifeless body...
Blake! Do you hear me?  Blake!
VARIOUS SHOTS of the empty campus.  Keri moves brazenly across school grounds, looking for the big brother....
As she passes the bell tower, she sees --
move inside the gymnasium... she quickly approaches --

hanging behind glass... she picks up a plastic skull, sma the glass with it... grabs the AXE and continues inside..

(calling off) Let's ends this right now.  You want to kill me to fulfill your twisted obsession, then go ahead. I'm tired of playing hide-and- seek, brother.  Come on, finish what you started, you miserable fuck.
Keri jumps... the gymnasium floor beneath her begins to m closing back over the pool...
Keri continues to move alongside the pool, when --
jumps from the bleachers, buries a knife deep into Keri's arm... she SCREAMS in pain... drops the fire axe into the pool.
The Shape pulls the knife from Keri's arm, stands above her... he raises the knife high into the air, about to pl it straight into Keri's heart, when --
Spins him around, comes face-to-face with...
standing behind him, wielding Keri's SMITH AND WESSON.  T SHAPE moves toward him.
JOHN empties the chamber into the Shape, thrust him backward...
falls into the pool, pulls Keri into the water with him..
struggles to climb out of the pool, the Shape fights to p her back in....
finds the axe, swings at Keri... slice open her thigh.
grabs Keri by the arms, manages to pull her out.
strives to climb out of the water as the gym floor contin to close... he swings the axe, buries the blade into the floor... grabs the handle, uses it to pull himself out...
grabs a JAVELIN hanging on the wall...
pulls his upper torso out of the water just as
raises the javelin high into the air, when --
Reaches out for her... then, a sound altogether unnatural
(a desperate plea) Laurie...
Time stands still -- TOTAL SILENCE.
ON KERI.  All the love and loss of the past twenty years plays all over her face, when --
Michael... (then) Go to hell!
plunges the javelin through his body with all her might, pierces his heart... the javelin juts out of his back.
arches his back in pain, grabs the metal rod... tries desperately to remove it, sinks into the water...
closes above him... CLANG!
Half the javelin sticks out above the floor... it twitche fiercely, then stops...
storms the gym, gun drawn... followed by Deputy Clark and dozen armed police officers.  He approaches Keri...

Keri and John embrace.
POLICE CARS litter the campus.  The corpse of THE SHAPE l covered on a gurney... a pair of PARAMEDICS roll it past
parked near the entrance, its rear doors open revealing -
being tended to by a PARAMEDIC.  Keri sits next to him...
I just can't believe she's dead.
Keri does the only thing a mother can do, gives him a hug
I love you, John.
Always the guy, John just shrugs, giving her a tough smil
Yeah, me too, Keri.
Call me Laurie, will ya?
Keri.... Laurie... how about if I just call you Mom?
That would work.
The two embrace an another PARAMEDIC closes the rear door the ambulance, locking Keri and John safely inside.
